Unusually high frequency of a single InvoiceNo might indicate data entry errors or duplicate transactions.
High frequency of certain StockCodes should be reviewed for potential errors or popular items.
Negative Quantity values would be implausible unless indicating returns, which should be clearly documented.
Extremely high Quantity values should be flagged for verification, as they might indicate data entry errors.
Unusual InvoiceDate timestamps (e.g., transactions outside business hours) should be reviewed.
UnitPrice significantly higher or lower than typical market values should be flagged for review.
Extremely low or high UnitPrice might indicate data entry errors or special promotions.
Duplicate CustomerIDs should be reviewed to ensure they represent the same entity.
Uncommon country names should be checked for spelling errors or incorrect entries.
